instructions: Apply these rules sequentially to classify goods under the Harmonized Tariff Schedule. Start with GRI 1 and only proceed to subsequent rules if classification cannot be determined. The US Additional Rules supplement the GRI for US-specific classification requirements.
classificationProcess: 1. First, attempt classification using GRI 1 (heading terms and section/chapter notes)
2. If the article is incomplete, unfinished, or disassembled, apply GRI 2
3. If classifiable under multiple headings, apply GRI 3 (a, then b, then c)
4. If still unclassifiable, apply GRI 4 (most akin)
5. Apply GRI 5 for containers and packing materials
6. Apply GRI 6 to determine subheading classification
7. Apply US Additional Rules for use-based classifications and parts provisions

generalRulesOfInterpretation.title: Classification by Heading Terms and Notes
generalRulesOfInterpretation.appliesWhen: Always apply first. This is the primary classification method.
generalRulesOfInterpretation.action: Classify according to the terms of the headings and any relative section or chapter notes.
generalRulesOfInterpretation.guidance: Ignore table of contents, alphabetical index, and titles of sections/chapters/sub-chaptersâ€”these are for reference only and have no legal effect.
generalRulesOfInterpretation.legalText: The table of contents, alphabetical index, and titles of sections, chapters and sub-chapters are provided for ease of reference only; for legal purposes, classification shall be determined according to the terms of the headings and any relative section or chapter notes and, provided such headings or notes do not otherwise require, according to the following provisions.

generalRulesOfInterpretation.title: Incomplete, Unfinished, Disassembled Articles and Mixtures
generalRulesOfInterpretation.appliesWhen: When the article is incomplete, unfinished, unassembled, disassembled, or consists of mixed materials/substances.

subRules.title: Incomplete or Unassembled Articles
subRules.appliesWhen: The article is incomplete, unfinished, unassembled, or disassembled.
subRules.action: Classify as if it were the complete or finished article, provided it has the essential character of the complete article.
subRules.legalText: Any reference in a heading to an article shall be taken to include a reference to that article incomplete or unfinished, provided that, as entered, the incomplete or unfinished article has the essential character of the complete or finished article. It shall also include a reference to that article complete or finished (or falling to be classified as complete or finished by virtue of this rule), entered unassembled or disassembled.

subRules.title: Mixtures and Combinations
subRules.appliesWhen: The heading references a material or substance, and the goods contain mixtures or combinations of materials.
subRules.action: Include mixtures or combinations of the named material with other materials. If goods consist of more than one material, proceed to GRI 3.
subRules.legalText: Any reference in a heading to a material or substance shall be taken to include a reference to mixtures or combinations of that material or substance with other materials or substances. Any reference to goods of a given material or substance shall be taken to include a reference to goods consisting wholly or partly of such material or substance. The classification of goods consisting of more than one material or substance shall be according to the principles of rule 3.

generalRulesOfInterpretation.title: Goods Classifiable Under Multiple Headings
generalRulesOfInterpretation.appliesWhen: Goods are prima facie classifiable under two or more headings (due to GRI 2(b) or any other reason).
generalRulesOfInterpretation.action: Apply sub-rules in order: first (a), then (b) if (a) fails, then (c) if both fail.
generalRulesOfInterpretation.legalText: When, by application of rule 2(b) or for any other reason, goods are, prima facie, classifiable under two or more headings, classification shall be effected as follows:

subRules.title: Most Specific Description
subRules.appliesWhen: One heading provides a more specific description than others.
subRules.action: Prefer the heading with the most specific description over headings with more general descriptions.
subRules.exception: When headings each refer to only part of the materials in mixed/composite goods or part of items in a retail set, treat them as equally specific even if one is more complete or precise.
subRules.legalText: The heading which provides the most specific description shall be preferred to headings providing a more general description. However, when two or more headings each refer to part only of the materials or substances contained in mixed or composite goods or to part only of the items in a set put up for retail sale, those headings are to be regarded as equally specific in relation to those goods, even if one of them gives a more complete or precise description of the goods.

subRules.title: Essential Character
subRules.appliesWhen: GRI 3(a) cannot resolve classification for mixtures, composite goods, or retail sets.
subRules.action: Classify based on the material or component that gives the goods their essential character.
subRules.legalText: Mixtures, composite goods consisting of different materials or made up of different components, and goods put up in sets for retail sale, which cannot be classified by reference to 3(a), shall be classified as if they consisted of the material or component which gives them their essential character, insofar as this criterion is applicable.

subRules.title: Last in Numerical Order
subRules.appliesWhen: Neither GRI 3(a) nor GRI 3(b) can resolve classification.
subRules.action: Classify under the heading that occurs last in numerical order among those equally meriting consideration.
subRules.legalText: When goods cannot be classified by reference to 3(a) or 3(b), they shall be classified under the heading which occurs last in numerical order among those which equally merit consideration.

generalRulesOfInterpretation.title: Classification by Similarity (Most Akin)
generalRulesOfInterpretation.appliesWhen: Goods cannot be classified using GRI 1-3.
generalRulesOfInterpretation.action: Classify under the heading appropriate to the goods to which they are most similar or akin.
generalRulesOfInterpretation.legalText: Goods which cannot be classified in accordance with the above rules shall be classified under the heading appropriate to the goods to which they are most akin.

generalRulesOfInterpretation.title: Containers and Packing Materials
generalRulesOfInterpretation.appliesWhen: Goods include specially fitted containers or packing materials.
generalRulesOfInterpretation.action: Apply in addition to foregoing rules for containers and packing.
generalRulesOfInterpretation.legalText: In addition to the foregoing provisions, the following rules shall apply in respect of the goods referred to therein:

subRules.title: Specially Fitted Containers
subRules.appliesWhen: Containers are specially shaped or fitted for a specific article, suitable for long-term use, and entered with the article.
subRules.action: Classify the container with the article it contains, if normally sold together.
subRules.exception: Does not apply if the container gives the whole its essential character.
subRules.examples: Camera cases, musical instrument cases, gun cases, drawing instrument cases, necklace cases.
subRules.legalText: Camera cases, musical instrument cases, gun cases, drawing instrument cases, necklace cases and similar containers, specially shaped or fitted to contain a specific article or set of articles, suitable for long-term use and entered with the articles for which they are intended, shall be classified with such articles when of a kind normally sold therewith. This rule does not, however, apply to containers which give the whole its essential character.

subRules.title: Packing Materials and Containers
subRules.appliesWhen: Packing materials or containers are entered with the goods.
subRules.action: Classify packing with the goods if it is of a kind normally used for packing such goods.
subRules.exception: Does not apply when packing materials or containers are clearly suitable for repetitive use.
subRules.legalText: Subject to the provisions of rule 5(a) above, packing materials and packing containers entered with the goods therein shall be classified with the goods if they are of a kind normally used for packing such goods. However, this provision is not binding when such packing materials or packing containers are clearly suitable for repetitive use.

generalRulesOfInterpretation.title: Subheading Classification
generalRulesOfInterpretation.appliesWhen: After determining the correct heading, you must determine the correct subheading.
generalRulesOfInterpretation.action: Apply the same GRI principles (mutatis mutandis) to subheadings, comparing only subheadings at the same level. Section, chapter, and subchapter notes also apply.
generalRulesOfInterpretation.legalText: For legal purposes, the classification of goods in the subheadings of a heading shall be determined according to the terms of those subheadings and any related subheading notes and, mutatis mutandis, to the above rules, on the understanding that only subheadings at the same level are comparable. For the purposes of this rule, the relative section, chapter and subchapter notes also apply, unless the context otherwise requires.

additionalUSRulesOfInterpretation.description: US-specific rules that supplement the GRI for goods imported into the United States.
additionalUSRulesOfInterpretation.appliesWhen: In the absence of special language or context which otherwise requires:

rules.title: Principal Use Classification
rules.appliesWhen: A tariff classification is controlled by use (other than actual use).
rules.action: Determine classification based on the principal use of that class or kind of goods in the United States at or immediately prior to importation.
rules.legalText: A tariff classification controlled by use (other than actual use) is to be determined in accordance with the use in the United States at, or immediately prior to, the date of importation, of goods of that class or kind to which the imported goods belong, and the controlling use is the principal use.

rules.title: Actual Use Classification
rules.appliesWhen: A tariff classification is controlled by actual use.
rules.action: Classification is satisfied only if: (1) the use is intended at importation, (2) the goods are actually so used, and (3) proof is furnished within 3 years of entry.
requirements: Use must be intended at time of importation
Goods must actually be used as intended
Proof must be furnished within 3 years after entry date
rules.legalText: A tariff classification controlled by the actual use to which the imported goods are put in the United States is satisfied only if such use is intended at the time of importation, the goods are so used and proof thereof is furnished within 3 years after the date the goods are entered.

rules.title: Parts Provisions
rules.action: A 'parts' provision covers products solely or principally used as parts, but a specific provision for that part or accessory takes precedence over a general 'parts' or 'parts and accessories' provision.
rules.legalText: A provision for parts of an article covers products solely or principally used as a part of such articles but a provision for 'parts' or 'parts and accessories' shall not prevail over a specific provision for such part or accessory.

rules.title: Textile Material Mixtures
rules.appliesWhen: Classifying goods in any provision where a textile material is named.
rules.action: Apply the principles of Section XI regarding mixtures of two or more textile materials.
rules.legalText: The principles of section XI regarding mixtures of two or more textile materials shall apply to the classification of goods in any provision in which a textile material is named.
